title: Too many choices, no criteria
context: Composite of graduates excited by multiple sectors but paralysed without clear decision filters.
session_flow: Externalised hopes, constraints and non-negotiables into a shared decision board.
Designed two-week experiments to test energy and learning in each shortlisted path.
Debriefed experiments to evolve criteria and notice when FOMO was masking preferences.
boundary_and_consent: Student chose which personal or family pressures stayed off the shared board and could pause any experiment that spiked anxiety.
timeframe: 4 sessions across 6 weeks with async check-ins after each experiment.
shift: They shifted from rumination to structured testing and made decisions with clearer evidence.
outcome: Committed to one path with a defined next action list and felt less reactive to peer comparisons.
disclaimer: Composite illustration; each person's journey is unique.
